title: support private events via caldav to apple calendar application
body:
events which are marked private (e.g. using lightning) are not shown as such in apple's calendar application.

it seems the caldav server must advertise itself as supporting private events according to their specification.

https://github.com/evert/calendarserver-extensions/blob/master/caldav-privateevents.txt

see also this zimbra bug: http://bugzilla.zimbra.com/show_bug.cgi?id=59842

### expected behaviour
it should be possible to create/edit a private event stored on an owncloud caldav server via apple's calendar.app just as it is in mozilla lightning.

### actual behaviour
such private events, which are visible as such in lightning, are shown as public in calendar.app.

### steps to reproduce
1. create a private event using lightning
2. view the same event in calendar.app
3. it's public.
4. no "private" option is available when creating an event in calendar.app.

### server configuration
operating system: linux

web server: apache 2.2.25

database: mysql 5.1.70-cli

php version: 5.3.27

owncloud version: 5.0.12

### client configuration
mozilla thunderbird 24.0.1 with lightning 2.6.1
apple calendar 7.0 (1835)

operating system: mac os x 10.9
